meanings.definition: A sculpted male figure serving as a column or pilaster in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: In ancient buildings, telamones were used as decorative columns.
meanings.sent2: The telamones in the temple were intricately carved and added grandeur to the structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the telamones were their guardians, standing tall and strong.
meanings.sent4: The telamones seemed to hold up the weight of history and stories within their stone forms.
meanings.sent5: The telamones, frozen in time, silently watched over the courtyard with their stoic expressions.

meanings.definition: A supporting column in the form of a male figure.
meanings.sent1: The telamones in the palace were not just decorative but also provided structural support.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the intricate details of the telamones that lined the hallways.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children tried to climb the telamones, thinking they were giant statues to play on.
meanings.sent4: The telamones stood tall like guardians, their presence giving a sense of strength and stability.
meanings.sent5: The telamones seemed to bear the weight of the ceiling effortlessly, as if they were born for that purpose.
